Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	The patient begins to speak about Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh sons, I have given you this book, which is the culmination of my knowledge in medicine, because it was my wish to die with such completion and for the explications and declarations made in it, I think that you will understand it better than anyone else by means of this treatise, which is a part of surgical art.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because the operation in my region and in our time is done secretly, behind closed doors, although it is very perilous to the science of it, and its study is not kept; nor will I leave but a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which have corrected the most and amended those errors and hesitations among them, so that their intentions may be understood, and the force of art may be extended.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And I think that you will revive that ancient order of this treatise according to the way of exposition and declaration and abridgment; and in order that it may take on the forms of the cautery instruments and of other work tools, whether by addition of the declaration or preparation of it, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The cause for which this art is not understood in our time, is that the art of medicine is long and that it is difficult for its actor to be exercised in the science of anatomy, which he has learned from Galen when he knew about the joints and their forms, and their connection and separation; and he knows the bones, nerves, and tendons, and their numbers and qualities; and about the pulsating veins and quiet ones, and their locations on the removal of theirs.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And so it is said that Hippocrates has this name, but in the work little and more so in the art of medicine.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said about that one in the introduction of this book; for who is not knowledgeable about it, does not understand anatomy, and therefore will not be able to escape error by which people will die, as I have seen many of those, because some of them are formed in this science and get lost from their knowledge and experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	That I saw a doctor mad and elderly who inflicted an abscess on the neck of a woman, and cut some arteries in the neck so that there flowed great blood within her before she died between those of hers.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who prescribed that the man swallow a piece of someone who had suffered in his condition, and the piece was large, and came to him and tore open that part further, so that that man died on the fourth day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	But I also asked to remove that one, and I saw that because of the size of the piece and due to the patient's condition it was clear to me that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	I saw another doctor who received a stipend from a duke of our land for surgery, and came to a blacksmith who was causing him a fracture in his cavity; and because of the doctor's ignorance, he removed the fracture on the wound with pillows and stakes with great tightness, without laying the wound flat again.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And he took away the patient according to his desires, and took him off the pillow, and took out the lancet after some days and commanded that we should take away the bandage; and thus until the cavity and the foot were closed up, and death was approached.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and I dressed his bandage, and achieved peace and cured the pain.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	May corruption was already confirmed in the member, so that it could not be restrained, and the corruption did not cease to wander through the member until the illness reached its peak.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And we saw another doctor who perforated an abscess with cancer, and it became ulcerated after several days, until the cancerous power of him consumed the lord of his body.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Which cause is that the cancerous wound is pure of melancholic humors, and thus it does not penetrate to him with iron from head to toe, but rather is in a member which has suffered so that the whole was infected.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And therefore, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation be divided into two parts: one is in the operation where there is associated health, and in the work where there is danger in the major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already existed in this entire location of this book where there has been a victory over operation in which is error and fear; therefore it is necessary for you to guard this and lay down, so that the leaves do not get into speaking about it and deceiving you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	We take up our arms in supplication and protection of God, and our sick ones with faith and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And we use the better way through God's grace to achieve salvation and glorious succession, and let us lay away the terrible illnesses of difficult healing, and our arms from this that makes you fear, so that your sight is fixed on your faith and in our name will not evade you: for what remains is to be added to your glory, and more so in the world and in the next life than in the sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	He also said something worthy of note:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat a bad illness as if it were good, lest you be called by those who do not know.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	 Begins the division of the book, and first from the first chapter.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered in the treatment of foot ailments, in the forms of instruments and in the fractures of the cautery, and from this what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, concerning dryness and perforation, wounds, and vesicles, as well as the extraction of arrows and similar tools, all chapters and ordered according to the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, concerning restoration and dislocation, treatment of twisted limbs and similar conditions; a chapter ordered from head to foot, according to the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On cauterization with fire and sharp medicine, and a recall of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	From that point on, the treatment for all free patients begins.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Specify the quality of the cautery instruments and their points, and in which complication it is prohibited to perform cautery.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, the discourse on the quality of cautery instruments and their points is long, prolix, subtle in knowledge, and hidden in secrecy; for there I have spoken much of the wise men, and they also disagree among themselves, and as for me, I will only mention a little of their discourses, which are long.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	I think it means: Therefore, the cautery will be applied to all parts of the complex body, which are made of matter or its matter, excluding two complex bodies, which are the tail's material.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	It means: In the complex tail and dry material body, dehydration will occur; because some people say that cautery is suitable for this one, and others say the opposite, that cautery is not convenient in illness of quality and dryness, because the nature of the fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient to heal an illness of a tail and dry material if it is cauteric and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	It means: And that one who said the opposite is also correct, because cautery is only performed on all tail and dry illness that occurs in human bodies, because when you compare the human body to the focus of humidity, the human body becomes dry.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	It means: I also say according to the word of that one, that I have experimented this already at some times for discovery.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	It means: However, I do not believe that it will come upon this which has already been discussed and exercised in the capital of cautery for later exercise, and because I know the diversity of human complexity and the arrangement of illnesses in their inner parts, and the causes of those, and the accidents of them, and the space of time of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other complications, it's not about your fear, and more in dry and humid diseases, where all the doctors have agreed on those, and you should not get distracted by the treatment of a cauterization in these.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	You should know, children, that the secret of healing by cauterization is through fire and its goodness, whereas treatment with medicine is burning something, because the fire is simple, the action of which affects only the member that is cauterized, and not the other members at all, except for a small damage.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of medicine burning affects that part in the members where it is absent, and thus it makes the diseased member come forth with a difficult healing and a great pain.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But the fire, by its sublimity and goodness of substance, does not do that but rather surpasses it; for we have already come to know through experimentation and long years of study of this art about the truth of causes; and therefore I excuse you from the length of speech. If it were not that I did not want to be legible in the middle, I would remain silent about my secret fire, and the quality of the operation on the body, and how it expels diseases, demonstrated philosophically, which is sharpened for your cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	It seems to be saying: "Be aware, sons, that the timing of when to do cauterization and pause for the best time for spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	It means: "I say that cauterization is suitable in any time, because the harm caused by an accident is submerged in the early stage of this when the treatment is applied, and especially if the cauterization is for painful or necessary pains, strong and sharp ones, which do not suffer delay to be feared by those who come with malice, which is greater than minor damage entering through the time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	It means: "And do not consider this in your own cases, or sons, for this is only the popular opinion and foolish doctors, so that because of that disease which is healed by cauterization, it is not always reliable, and pause on that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	It means: "The cause is not the same as what they think causes it, because cauterization is only in place of medicine which alters the complexity and dries out the humidity, which are the causes of pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	It means: "But perhaps cauterization is superfluous over medicine due to the unpredictability of its virtue and value from its operation and the greatness of his lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that his illness will return at some hour of the day, according to the complexity of the illness and the location of its affliction, and also the virtue of it, and thus that is prepared in the body of him by the addition of superfluities in him, and thus pervaded to him from the acquisition of food and resemblance to those causes; but if the illness with cauterization applied is a subtle illness in some few superfluous parts and humidities, like cauteri of teeth for pain and resemblance to it, then it is possible that in him will not return that pain, but instead this is done in points.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And more commonly it is said that cauterization is the last resort of medicine, and it's said to be most suitable, not for what I understand in it, because those who create it do not cure with it, but rather profit from it and by another cause.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	The cause is in the opposite; and I understand that cauterization is the last resort of medicine only when they administer various treatments for certain illnesses, and those medicines do not work, and thus at the end of the cause they apply cauterization to profit from it.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	When cold humors are infiltrated into each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	They said that cautery of gold is better than cautery of iron, and they did not say this because of the superiority of gold and the nobility of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	They said that the location of cautery does not matter, because it is not absolutely true, since you know that I have done it and have not lied, whereas in other cases it was done so only on the flesh, and cautery with iron is better than with gold as they claimed; but however, when you do cautery with a gold rod, it is not for your declaration, because it is known according to the quantity you wish, by the roughness of gold, and how you prepare yourself to receive friction; and if you set fire to the gold, some plates will fall into the fire, so that the artisan can cut through the occupation of those.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And therefore cautery with iron is done more lightly and more towards the end of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	I have translated the line into English:
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Pain caused by inflammation of the head due to cold and dampness.
Le capitol primier.	The first principle.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery confers on the cold and dampness a most unfortunate accident from which arise two causes, one being the excess of sour humors and many violent fluxes called corissa, running from the head to the parts of the heels and ears, and many sleeplessness, and pain of teeth, and gingivitis, and universally all diseases that come by coldness, so as if paralyzed, poisoned, or apopleptic, and resemble those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is as follows: firstly, it commands the illness to be evacuated with laxative medicine on the head for three or four nights, according to what the sickness demands and the age and custom of the person.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And it commands him to shave his head with a razor, and then he should cut that braid between your fingers on a cypress board, and place your hands over the spot on the ground.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then you should pause your finger on the pressure of the tip of the nose between the heels of his feet.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	Despite your doctor's words about the middle area being correct, this spot has been tried, and place olive oil cauterization on it.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And place him on the spot where it has been tried, in such a way that the weight is distributed evenly, so that your hand is tightly compressed little by little, and you rotate him.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And raise your hand lightly and look at the spot, and if you see again that bone is exposed some quantity of it, like the amount of sand in an hourglass, then elevate your hand, and if not turn your hand back to that iron, use another one, if it is chilled, until you have seen the bone as I told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And take a small amount of salt and dissolve it on the spot, and let it lie there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And place yourself on the spot, in the beginning, on the border, and let it lie there until the scar of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And cure the spot with antimony tetraformula until it cures.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	They said that when the plague persists in its opening, it is better to treat the arm, for it is more advantageous and helpful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	They said that the ligature should be cauterized within the bone, and that the cautery should be held in place until some part of the bone is fully united.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And let it be dried so that the bone is tightly closed, and let it be cured.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	They said that the cautery should penetrate deep into the flesh, until it presses strongly upon the bone and causes the bone to swell in proportion, this is the way of applying an incision.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They consider that from that location, the vapors of the head will expire.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	Let the plague be kept open for a long time, and let it be cured until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura. De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cauterization of nasal odor.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat that person with water which they have mentioned in the division and it has not benefited your treatment, then take your equipment and give the patient the coca leaves to drink for three nights; and place a cloth on their head, and cauterize them with two small olive-wood cauterizations.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And place the cautery on that point, placing two cauteries over both eyebrows, just above those hair follicles, a little.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	Watch yourself from the arrow that will not set you on fire.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	This is the form of the pointed cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of cauteries for the softening of eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by disease or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with one cautery and this is the form of it:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, cauterize that one above the two eyebrows a little with two cauteries all over the eye.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And be the length of any cautery according to the quantity of eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand and the cautery, but according to the quantity that the tender part of the eyelid is injured.
Capitol .xvi.	Book of the physician, chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Cauterizing of the eyelid of the foot when the skin is converted to the parts of the palm and finger of the foot.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skin of the foot is converted to the parts of the palm and finger as it becomes inflamed, cutting in those places according to two methods: either cut or apply medicine that burns.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If it is fire that burns from there, command the servant in front of this area to read out these words as they touch those areas which will be cleansed; and until they are prolonged and washed; and if one has to take his foot, then place a bandage on it afterwards so that it does not enter into the wounds where the skin is born.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then, when they are cleansed and washed, afterwards pause the head of the servant in front of you, and place a sign on the eyelids of the foot with a mark that is according to the shape of an oak leaf, which is the beginning of the mark near the skin.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And place a stopper at the beginning of the wound, either in an ovum of wool or in a mucilage of hair on the foot.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	Make ready the cautery of which this is the form.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Appoint cauterize over the figure which you have marked, small by small, in moles arranged, until the surface of the tendon is burned, just like the leaf of myrtle, all appearing so.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The sign of a good outcome from your work is that you see the eyelid of the foot contract and the skin of it raised, due to the point on the heel.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	So therefore lift up your hand and hold it on that spot for three days, and place a pause over it at the border until the scab is formed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Make her cure that wound until she heals.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if she returns through the hairs some cause and the eyelid is softened, then do it again over that as you did initially.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are in the eyelid as well, then cauterize that there until it is raised to its natural place and covered up so that the hairs do not hurt the heel.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	The translation is: 
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	He cannot provide that information.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	Pause the medicine on it and do not put it in your mouth until the patient bites down on it, as if they were biting into a hot coal.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	Therefore, when you notice that the pain in biting down has ceased, then let out the medicine and moisten your hand with water; and then consider if sometimes the eyelid is lifted as it is washed away due to the heat or incision, whether it be so. And if not, then return to the place where the medicine was applied and do not put anything between until you complete your operation and sew the wound shut.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Pause on that spot until the codon of the constriction is eradicated, and then treat it with enemas or another remedy to heal.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	It is necessary to you that you keep vigilent diligence in your operation so that the pain in the heel does not fall back on the medicine, and if the eyelid becomes soft after 12 days, and no cause of the nails pricking at the heel, then iterate your medicine over that place where the eyelid is soft, and properly apply it at first, and let it run into when it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the form of myrrh leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	You know that the heels of men are diverse in size and thinness, therefore according to this it is done your counteraction.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not hide the path of the retouter back to that which is studied in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cauterization of a fistula that is in the tear duct of the heel.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you cure a fistula in this way that have been said in the divisions of the diseases and do not confer your healing, then cover yourself as follows: command the patient to put his head on the side you, and keep your hand between your fingers in such a way that it is not pressed or agitated at the top of the patient's head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	To prevent the inflammation from spreading to other parts of the body, place a poultice made of gum or wool into the affected area.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Let them use the cautery whose method is this:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is shaped like a cane or a spike, from one end to the other, along which the cautery is applied.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, it penetrates into the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want, it opens up like an aperture or a hole.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But that which is covered is better than the other's work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And apply ointment to the fistula if it is open, and drain from it, dry out that part.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and remove the purulent mass.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And place over it the cautery which is hot, and put on that hand a little bit of the cautery from the heel to the root of the nail, so that you do not touch your hand or the sickness is disturbed, and then place the cautery in the gray area of the heel and corrupt that.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	If the cauterization enters into your bone, it is well; if not, then iterate the cauterization one or two times, as needed, and let that area be kept still for three days, and place a poultice on that spot both inside and outside of it until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	If it has been thirty-one days and the sickness has not healed, then pause over the harsh medical treatment until the bone is exposed and is cut as needed according to what is prescribed in their capital.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another method of cauterizing an abscess that they said was true first: dig in the location of the abscess and put a stop to it and press on that subtle fissure, which is the form of it: There is a quantity of lead melted equal to one ounce; and place your hand on top of it with good grip, so that the sickness does not come upon you so that the melted lead does not reach the heel of that person; and be careful to pause over the heel of the sick person where there is an oily or watery albumen, because the lead adheres to the location of the abscess and cures it with marvelous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	If the fistula is healed as we have said about the cauterization and cure, it is good; otherwise, it is necessary to administer treatment through the nose and reduce the fistula into the nostril according to where it comes.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cauterization of the wound on the penis.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Common and frequent accidents occur fissures in the labia, especially in those of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you cure those fissures as we have said in the divisions and do not improve with your treatment, then apply the cauterization of small scissor-like instruments according to this shape that is inserted:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And so, if it fits the cavity of him according to the subtlety of a spoon.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Place the instrument cautiously in those fissures until the cauterization reaches the root of the fissure.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And cure that one with cerat [ possibly a mistake, could be "cera" or "cerumen"] inside where it is healthy.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Treating a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When an ulcer appears on the uvula or in the palate or at the roots of the teeth, and you apply pressure and cut it, and if it is ruptured and dried up, and if a fistula forms, you should treat that and do not prolong the treatment, since you know how to cauterize according to the amount received by the fistula, put that fire in the track of the fistula, and let your hand enter so that the hot iron reaches the root of it, and at the end, make a mark or two; and treat that afterwards, as they have told us about the treatment until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And therefore if the wound is open and healed, then it is good; otherwise, since there is a need to discover the place and expose the corrupted bone according to where it comes into its head.
Capitol .xx.	Head.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Treating cauterization of the teeth and softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by humidity and the teeth are sharp, treat those with medicines and do not confide in them, otherwise pause the head of the patient on your own side, and apply the cauterizing fire in its form so that you pause the one which comes to fit there, in such a way that you put your hand inside where the cauterizing fire is placed, fastening it firmly, and let the heat of the fire penetrate into the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Take your hand and take out the cautery some times according to what you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And take the patient's mouth full of salt water and hold it for an hour, because the swollen gums are firm and the humidity corrupted is dried.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the cautery for tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to coldness, or if it's frozen or swollen, you do not apply treatment with medicine, but rather perform cautery in two ways: either by applying a border of cowhide or by applying fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery with the border (boder) means you take cowhide, fill it with blisters in a metal container, then wrap and cover the lower part of the leg, immerse that with the blistered side over the painful tooth, and hold it firmly until it is cooled.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	Take out that (cauterized with fire) some times until the virtue of the fire reaches the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	If you see, put wool or cord in the border where this is said, and pause it on the aching tooth, and pause on that burning iron until the iron enters the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	But the cauterization of the focus is that you attend to the quantity of earwax or iron, so that it does not enter the core of him too much and do not let the heat of the focus reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And carefully hold the cauterizing iron in a shape that will come to be, and pause it on the tooth and place your hand into it while the iron is heated; and do this occasionally so that the pain subsides or in one day or in another day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is good that by the impression of that cauterizing iron, the ulcer moves its jaw to a better border and holds onto it for one hour and let him spew. And this is the form of the cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize as far as you see extension according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	This is the form of the needle:
Capitol .xxii.	The opening of a gouty constitution.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the cauterization of protruding parts.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When protruding parts are caused by inflammation and cold humors that do not submit to digestion through medicine, you will make a gentle digestion of those. However, if the cauterization follows the shape of which this is described, having two extremities swollen in order to set fire to the fume, you must light the cauterization on the other extremity, and pause it upon that swelling for a while, and another if you require, until it reaches the root of the swelling.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the swelling is small, then pause the cauterization according to the quantity of the swelling, and let it be licked for three days, and pause over the spot where it has been fumigated until it becomes redened because the fire has burned.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And provide a gentle balm, ointments, and drapes to cure that wound until it heals.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the needle or cauterization instrument is thus.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Cauterization of the raw area and constriction of the vein.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When moistness of the vein occurs over the lung area, and more so when it is accompanied by congestion of the complex, then cover that the malady should be evacuated from the beginning with laxative medicines, and cauterize accordingly on the spot where it is causing the pain.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	Be careful that you do not go too far with the cautery or burn yourself on the gout, nor cut too close to the tendon of it.

E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	Place that one on afterwards, so it may heal.
Capitol .xxiiii.	End of the book. xxiv (meaning 24) indicates the end of a medical treatise or manuscript.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	Cauterization of pulmonary illness and cough.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and pulmonary illness are caused by moist humors, and the disease does not have fever or phlegm, then it is an ancient illness, cover that with two cauteries on the furcula in the areas of pain on the shoulders and elbows; and another cauteri on the middle part of the foot between the two nipples; and do the cautery as before the form.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	If you wish, perform the puncture point procedure with the same instrument that is called punctum, which was previously described in the treatment of arthralgia.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	Insert the points into the cavities, and thus cure that one with what is administered by doctors who have previously treated it so that it may be healed.
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And even if you have three arrows stuck in it; for cauterization is that: once you can do three cauterizations according to this form:
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On the cauterization of the title, which is the head of the assistant.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the assistant is displaced due to lubricous humidity and does not stay in place during his return, you should make it enter that place where custom makes it return, and by a small movement, he gets back into place, as we have testified, always covering that which first reduces the displacement, and reversing the illness onto the patient's arms or onto their side, since on one of these parts of the head the joint is displaced.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	Make sure the cautery has two handles; this is its form:
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	Make sure to cauterize the tendon inside as it penetrates into the other flesh; and come will be the figure of cauterization, usually done with four cauterizations.
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	So fine according to the quantity of tenement; and this is its form:
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	Some are adjusted according to this count and for that reason they have cauterizations.
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	Place your hand over the cautery for a little while after you have salted it; and place the wound in quietude, so that the limb is not irritated for any time until it is comfortable.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	If dislocation is at the joints and parts above, this is done: make it so that cautery is applied to the muscle where the clavicle or pointed cauterization is made, because the joint is confirmed and moisture is dried out, and the wound heals.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter XXVI.
De cauterizacio del stomac.	Of Cauterization of the Stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When pain occurs in the stomach and moths (or humors) enter that part of its complexity and are multiplied inside, and if you continue with the ways of treatment without confidence, it is customary that the illness will be on their backside, and they stretch their hands and their cushions, and appropriate to cauterize that area three times: one on the foot for the amount of a single cauterized digit, and two on each side of the cauteri (the triangle-shaped figure), until the figure of cauterization appears; and make sure that those not in place will do pouredura.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	If the depth of the cauteri is equal to the thickness of two-thirds of the cord-like structure.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And if it is the form of the cauteri according to this addition, and if you want, cauterize a large cauteri in the middle of the stomach according to this shape; and let that be a cauteri according to the form of a circle according to this figure:
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	Let the stomach be cauterized at the point where this cauteri is feared: and it is that you sense over the point on the stomach according to the quantity you want, and appropriate to cauterize that one with a cauteri in the points; and appropriate cure that one with the treatment that was preceded inside so that it heals.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	The operation of cauterizing the bowels.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When suffering in the bowels due to coldness or humidity, or because of excessive windiness, where the bowel's normal complexity is lost through excessive egress, and you have said so and do not comfort him, you should place the patient on his back, and sense if the patient has tried three cauterizations according to this form and amount over the bowels with those intestines, which are called ipocondric.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	The space between each cauterization, according to the thickness of the vein, and the cauterizations according to the length of the body directly.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	Do not buy more than your allowance in cauteries.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	If the quantity of fluid is matched with the quantity of the substance of the cord, and it's not adjusted; if the patient stands on his feet of him; and if he is standing, then immediately let him lie down, which has already extended its spaces, and elevate his legs.
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	This is how the cautery looks:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	It is to you if you wish to perform these cauteries with the razor-cutting cautery, when it is with your subtlety and prudence in this art.
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	Be careful not to burn yourself too much in the cautery and let it be proportionate to the extent of all the veins so that it is proportionate throughout the body and comes into the intestines, for this cord here is subtle; therefore be aware.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter XXVIII.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	On the perforation of an apostaema on the foot with a cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When an apostaema occurs on the foot and you want to know if it is in the flesh of the foot or in the stocking of it, then if it is in the flesh of the foot, the malady is very grave and pain is greatly intensified.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	But if it is in the stocking of the foot, with great pain and many times already fatigued by doctors' cures.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	Therefore cover the wound with the side of the scalp; and place the location of the apostaema with cauterization, the form of which has been described on the previous page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	I cauterize on that spot and apply the cautery inside where the entire cord is conjoined, until it reaches the phlegm, until it dries up into a scab.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	And cure that by applying the treatment of other sores until it is healed.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And not to use this form of cauterization unless that which is studied in the art of medicine has been extended and that with which many diseases are known; but it seems to me that this one is experimented on some times being too bold over this operation, but yet however, let us heed that which comes from others, and it is good.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX.
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	On the treatment of ulcers through cautery.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	Those ancient cauteries of the art of astrology are said to be effective for ulcers according to this manner, and therefore you should take from the art of astrology a long, dry root with a pointed tip that is found, and place it on the ulcer.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	And you should submerge that in oil and then apply it to the heat, and then cautery with a small cautery in that place where the continuation of the furcula is at the neck; I have two small cauteries, one leaning towards the departure from the beard, and two small ones leaning between the fifth cost and the groin, inclining slightly towards the parts behind; and another cautery in the middle of the foot; and another on the stomach, and three cauteries behind; and one in that place where there is between the two spillas, and two cauteries on the two sides of the foot, those which are between the two spillas.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And you cannot buy your hand with a cautery, but rather are it in the bill of the code in the work.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And they have also spoken of other kinds of cauteries that are made from metal, like a flame, and placed in that location between the ribs, until it arrives at that swelling and is removed along with the sickness.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	But in this puncture with cautery is not the fear, because how much more often does it happen at that place where there is a fistula which cannot be cured.

De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	On the cautery of the nipple.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When you are treating the illness of the nipple with what they have said about the cure in the division and do not consider your own treatment, then if it is so that cautery is made on him, this is done in three ways, which all prove to be effective, of which one is that you make three cauteries or four linings according to the length of the nipple according to the shape of the cauteries of the fistula, the shape of which has preceded.

E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	It's the elevation you lift, which lifts the ligament according to the length of the body, so that the cauteries are applied in proportion to the width of the body.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	Now bring the two vermitions (or incisions) together, and sew them shut, in that entrance where those penetrate the ligament of the other side.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And now remove the cautery; and so it will be four cauteries.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	If you see, then apply the cautery point without three verniments.
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	And appropriate the cautery wound so that it has laid flat on your arm for three days, because more is needed to confirm than other causes in the cure.

De cauterizacio de ydropici.	Of the cautery for dropsy.

When you cure the dropsy, follow the maneuvers of cure which have been said in the division, but do not rely solely on your own treatment, otherwise cover yourself with having performed four cauteries around the navel and one cautery on the stomach, and another on the liver, and another on the gallbladder, and two cauteries between the vertebrae of the back, and one cautery in the third toe, and another on the stomach.
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	And the quantity of the depth of the cautery should be proportionate to the severity of the condition.

De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	Removal of the inflammation from fistulas that occur naturally in the parts of the body.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When nature does not follow the work that we have recommended in its place, and the patient is frightened by this, then he (the doctor) will apply the cautery.
