Capitol .xxxix.	Book XLIX.
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	On the cautering of the armpit.
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When swelling and humidity occur in the armpit, and as a result it is forbidden to pressuring, and the menstrual blood of him spoils, and it is delayed the process of them, and accidents pain happens because of their having in them, then cover that place with three cauteries around the navel, as we have said in the cautering of the bladder; and make a cutting on lower part of the back or two if necessary, and also make a cutting on the fingernails.
Capitol .xl.	Book L.
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	On the cautering of the dislocation of the ankle.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When moist mucus is spilled at the beginning of the ankle, and causes pain in the surrounding area of its location, and especially when these are compared between them, it is prolonged over the other.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	The location of the dislocation is made in the place where the bone sticks.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Therefore cover the wound on the spot where the anus is located with a pointed cautery similar to that used to cut through, since you will have some sensation in the surrounding area as it turns around, and for this reason, the turn falls into the middle of the circle.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	This is the instrument from which the shape was derived, in relation to the cautery for stomach incision.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	If that cautery is not at your disposal, then use olive wood with three points.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Make the cautery according to the quantity of the flesh of the entire cord, and place care within it so that it heals.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter forty-one.
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On the cautery of the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain comes out at the anus, and is caused by cold and humidity, the wound is healed with that which we have said and do not trust in, this being old-fashioned, then cover that you are treating the patient of gross humors with fetid pills or artificial pills similar to them; and make cautery on it.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	The text means: The method of applying the cautery on that area is according to two methods: either with medicine that burns (combustion), or with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	The text means: Sir follows two scientific methods, of which one is that it cauters the area over the beginning of the incision with three triangular cauteries of good depth.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	The text means: And the space between each cautery is of the same quantity as the size of the finger, whether it be olive-sized or large.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	The text means: But sometimes the cauteries are placed over the middle area of the head, because there are four cauteries.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	The text means: And if you want, cautery the circle where the form is placed during the cautery of the ankle dislocation, so that it be a continuous circle and burn the tendon.
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	The text means: And this is the way of cautery in incision when the pain is stuck to the ankle and not spread into the cavity.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	The text means: But if it is spread into the cavity, then sometimes cautery is done with two cauteries over the cavity on the area where you apply the malleture (pain) which is the pain; and one cautery on the bone for four days a little before the bone side.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	If the cautery cutter cuts through, and its depth follows the quantity of the flesh of the cord.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	If the gallstone spreads so that the pain is extended into the area around the foot, then always cauterize that place with a pointed instrument for three points or four or more if it seems necessary.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	If the gallstone spreads so that pain is left in the lower part of the belly, then always cauterize that place with a pointed cutter.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	Be careful in all cauterization that you do not leave the pointed instrument on until nerve burns or severe bleeding occur, and thereby cause the gallstone to move unnecessarily.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And I have also seen another of those who cauterize over the bladder and leave it on until the end of the cauterization, when the inflammation is increased inside where the tumor has succeeded in reaching the flesh, and the fire perforates and corrupts all the flesh.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And thus there is a strong solution for the stomach, and also this, death.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	If the pain is in two places in the same joint, then cauterize each one according to this method.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	They also say that among the wise men, it is known about the cauterization of each of which this is the method: make a circle of iron wire whose circumference is half the size of a palm; and be sure its orifices are according to the size of an almond or one little more.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And taking that circle to another turn; and the space between them is the size of one inch per foot; and those circles are on two parts; and the length of those segments is one or two inches, and make those iron margins decently fit into the circles; and this is the form of it:
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	And then ignite it in the fire that it reddens and throw sparks, and place it over the part of which it is; the sick person laid on its side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And thus, cauterize that area three times around in one round.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And place that on for three days; apply plaster to that area and lather the wound open for four days; and cure that area with application of ointment until it is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Diys Albucasis says: Oh, sons, this type of cautery has been used very little for the fear of its observation, and as a result, they have only found those that are related to it.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	May the healthy ones be preserved with this type of cautery, and let us beware of that place.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	May the cautery be a medicine that, when you perform two circles on the arm with an arrow pierced through it, where they will let out the swelling of the opening of the artery; whether the length of the wall in the lower part of the neck is twice or half those.
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And if the space between which is equal to the quantity of the swelling in question; and there are points above and below, such that they contain each other in this form:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	And place your hand over the beginning of the ulcer on the side, and press it gently over the beginning of the ulcer; and take cold water and stir between two circles, and that quality shall be like a fire small by small, until you reach one hour, and the disease is relieved by the chewing and the pressure of him — as if he were burning with fire — until the pressure ceases.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	I elevate my hand with the instrument and wipe off all the cold water from the entire ankle area with hot water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	I will massage that area for three days and pause over it between the third and fourth day when the pain of the stiffness is renewed, and I will massage again for several days, and run from there to the bowels; this is done in youth.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	I will treat that with poultice until it is healed.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	If the pain is extended within the body or between the thighs, I place that person in a position where they contain water, as it is said in the book of waters.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	This is the method of cold water, and I have already written about it in The Treatise on the Rectification of Medicines.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Recipe for alkaline and caustic mixture: Take one part of each from two separate passages, chop them up and put them in a new solution which leaves the first passage perforated with a small cut, according to the quantity that enters it.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	Then put the bottom of that solution into another inverted vessel, and pour over it alkaline and caustic mixture from hot water, which causes these to coagulate for one day, then press them with your hand to good compression, and massage the hole so that cold water comes out from that inverted solution.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	To adjust all that water, and get it over another caustic substance and another acid remedy, because that will always be of strong heat, which is administered in various medical operations and cauterizations of other members, where the operation brings on fire.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And so of those medicines some are which are cauterized extensively, like the application of thyme and vinegar and others which have a strong smell, and these are mixed with something that they say will be beneficial.
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	And Gualia recounts the case of an old man with the operation and cure about which he was cured of pain in his back and sciatica, and magnifies how much better it is than that one, and says that no further cure is needed, and that is healing for one day just as I recommended, for very light and easy to lie down and relax as that one.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	And it is that if he has taken a certain green herb, and if not, the fig leaves; and one must be pounded with a little gray and placed on the back in which there is pain, or on the cavity, or on the leg, and tied.
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	The text means: And let it be left for three hours or according to the quantity that the malady causes relaxation of the joint.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	The text means: And put that one in bed and as soon as the body of him is relaxed, introduce that into the floor, so that the pain ceases and he heals.
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	The text means: It is known that no one uses any cautery except for the evacuation of the body.
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	The text means: But Escorides said that when you cut the goat's vein the ligature is tightened and it benefits much; and so he uses this method: take wool and put it in oil old, and put it between the toes of the foot and between the knuckle.
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	The text means: And take dry goat's vein and apply it to the affected area with hot coals until it is burned, and then place it on the wool and let it be stretched into that.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	The text means: And repeat this [the application of the goat's vein] and do not cease doing it until the sensation of the biting is felt in the anus and rest the pain.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	This method of cautery is called cattle cauterization.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter forty-two.
De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.	Of the cautery for double pain.
Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida.	Some cases of pain occur in both feet due to various causes, such as falling, percussion, or excessive evacuation, and causes similar to those, due to the infusion of wet matter.
E cauteri no catz sino en aquesta sola specia la qual es fayta per efusio de materia frega.	Cauterization is not done for this type alone, but only in this one kind which is made by the effusion of wet matter.
Donc cove, aprop evacuacio del malaute am pillulas fitidas e am semblant a lor, que sian faytas sobre·l dos en le qual es la dolor tres linhas segon la latitut de lu, pus que senhas am tentha en quascuna linha v cauteris o mays, segon la quantitat que ve de la tolleransa del malaute e de la vertut de lu.	Therefore, evacuate the patient with suitable pills and similar in form, which cause pain on both feet, exactly three lines apart according to the location of the pain, since some have it in one line, or more, depending on how much is shown from the tolerance of the patient and its virtue.
E sia fayta cauterizacio am cauteri de punt.	And it must be done cautery with a pointed cauter.

Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43.
De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	Cauterization at the beginning of gout.
Motas veguadas endeve aquesta malautia als petitz enfantz; e senhal del comensament de lu en les enfantz es que accideys sobre lor estrectura en le ale eves la elevacio e·l movement.	Small wounds are often seen in this disease at the feet of children, and it is customary that they occur on their elbow joint due to its stiffness, elevation, and movement.
E atrobas en le derier espondil del dos e dels notz de lu que ja comensa a sobremontar sobre les autres spondils.	And it is also found in the lower back, specifically on the second and ninth vertebrae, where symptoms begin to appear over others.
E donc quan tu vezes aquo e voles prohibir, lahoras cauterisa aquel am cauteri que sia cercle segon aquesta forma:	And therefore when you cut it and want to stop it, do so with a circular cautery of the same shape as this.
que prengua le cauteri sobre tota partida del spondilh engualment.	which grasps the cauterium over the entire segment of the spinal joint.
E si vols, cauteriza en le circuit del spondilh am le cauteri de punt dos linhas o tres.	And if you wish, cuterize at the curve of the spinal joint with a pointed cautery, two lines or three.
E sian les puntz propdas entre lor.	Are they directly above them.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat am aquo que havem dit.	And place the cure over that area so that it is according to what has been said.
Mays guarda que cauteri no sia administrat en gelbositat que sia fayta per spasme de nervi.	However, be cautious that cautery should not be administered in gout that is caused by spasms of nerves.
Capitol .xliv.	The capital letter at the beginning of a section often denotes a title or heading.
De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	Treatment of gout and joint pain.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E donc cum es curada podagra de causa frega am manieyra de cura e no so remaugudas las dolors, lahoras las remau cauteri.	And therefore how it is cured gout due to cold humors in a manner of cure, and not simply removing the pains, because of cauterization.
E es que tu cauterizas aquel aprop evacuacio en le circuit de la junctura del pe am motz cauteris.	And is that you cauterize the area surrounding the evacuation in the joint of the foot with pointed cauterization.
E sia cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And is made from olive wood, whose form is this:
E si es necessitat que puntz sia fayt sobre la fassia del pe, lahoras fay am cauteri de punt.	And if it is necessary to make points on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery.
E si las dolors pujan entro als denolhs o a las autras juncturas, e aquo motas vetz s’endeve, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre quascun donolh am tres cauteris o quatre de tota partida am aquest cauteri olivar.	And if the pains rise into the joints or to other joints, and it is necessary to make it worse, then cauterize that on any joint with three cauterizations or four all around with this olive wood cauterization.
E si motz cauteris que aquestz cauteris sian a tu necessaris, lahoras cauteriza aquel e no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri abans, sia tant solament enviro la specitut de la codena.	If you think the cauterics are needed to be applied, then apply them and do not press too hard on your hand with the cauteric before, so that it only touches the spot of the wound.
E si las dolors pugan entro al donolh e·l dos, lahoras aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le sieu capitol.	If the pains go into the groin and the two, then administer the cautery which we have stated in our capital.
E si las dolors so en las mas tant solament, e es apelada suagra, lahoras puncta en le circuit dels focils ayssi cum se revolvo, puncta en aquels dos linhas.	If the pains are in the breasts only, and it is called gout, then make points on the cartilage of the elbow in such a way as if you were rolling, make points in those two lines.
E si reman de las dolors en les ditz, lahoras puncta en le cercuit dels focils sobre quascun notz e sobre la pinche de la ma.	If the pains remain in the fingers, then make points on the cartilage over any spot and over the fingernail.
E si las dolors pugan aprop alscus jorns als coydes o als muscles, lahoras cauteriza les quascus de tota part dels ajutoris.	If the pains go near any joints or muscles, then cauterize all those parts of the injured limb.
E no evacuas le malaute de bon regiment e de recepcio de medicinas, quar si es fayt bon regiment e flacma es evacuada am aquest cauteri sira sanat, Dieus ajudan.	And do not evacuate the sick from good care and reception of medicines, for if it is done with this cautery it brings sickness, God helps.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter forty-five.
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	Treatment of fractures.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When the fracture occurs in the neck and the bowels are tied to the intestine, as long as you cause them to open, the patient should lay aside his food for a day and use gentle causes to make the wound of the belly.
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	And follow the patient between your hands over his back, and command him to hold his breath until it is either passed out or the intestine or bowels appear.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	And return that arm to the hand and stretch it out to try to reduce the fracture on the bone of the little finger, so that the extremity appears similar to the middle finger's parts going upwards from the body.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And apply the cautery of which this is the form:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	until it is red hot and emits sparks.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	And return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from coming out.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	You have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, and another servant has placed another cushion on their legs, while another servant holds one of their hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	Place the cauterium on that spot until you can see the bone of the penis in the middle of the wound, and then go to another place if at first you do not succeed in the initial position into the bone.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	Observe the savour of the intestine at the time of your cauterization, lest you burn that intestine, lest the disease spreads into mortal or great evil on the patient.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	Know that when you have the cauterium and do not touch the bone, do not proceed with your operation.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	Be mindful that the cauterium for children should be subtle according to their size and proportion.

De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	Of the restoration of strong teeth with gold or silver wire.

E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And the wire should be so subtle and coarse in proportion to the amount that can enter between the teeth; and the form of the resection is such that you take the wire and insert it twice between two healthy teeth, and shape so that as you grow it with two twists on the wire between two molar teeth, or one or two, until the thread reaches into the healthy tooth of the other part.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And now proceed to the tissue inside from where you started, and strengthen your hand with ease and skill until it is not awkward.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	So be your strict rule, to which you must strengthen the thread, as a result of dental roots that will not escape.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And now cut off the superfluous ends of the thread with forceps or scissors, and place them in some place where you gesture, and convert those into and conceal them between the healthy tooth and the rotten one, so that it does not cause damage to the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And now cut that straight line with a Roman sword.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	If it is torn or ripped, strengthen that one or those in another manner until all its time.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of the teeth and the figure of the correction of two healthy teeth and two rotten ones, as often these are joined:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	When one returns a tooth or two to its own case in those places, and grow again as if they had remained recorded, and are renewed.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And it is done so by skilled artists and wise men.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And some times it is done with the bones of a cow, and is made from them in the shape of teeth, and is fixed in the place where the tooth failed, and is strengthened as we have said, and remains and serves for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	On the beginning of a complaint, which is spoken in the tongue and prohibits speaking.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This language which allows some people to speak with their tongue, sometimes it is natural as they are used to it, or accidental and happens when a plague has already set in.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation is that you open the mouth of the patient, and your cap or presence exists in the throat area; and raise their tongue, and apply that nervous complaint according to its location until it is solved with the loosening of the tongue.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	But if there is any hardness or inflammation, and it has been already consolidated by the plague, then you apply an ointment and split that further according to its location until you have cut open the complaint and dissolved the inflammation.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	Be careful that you do not make a tear in the skin before cutting, and cut here where the cartilage is and let the blood flow freely.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	And appropriate clean the vestiges of the incision with vinegar or wine or water, and pause leaving its tongue dry; so is a thing that keeps the patient from having its tongue in any other place, lest it be consolidated elsewhere.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	But if the blood flows, pause over the vitriolic tripe; but if the blood does not flow, then cauterize the place with a pointed cautery, as is suitable for this.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And appropriate that cure for other causes within which the disease may be cured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XXXV.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	On the extraction of a ranula from the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	There are some occasions where the tongue's appendix forms a small nodule that prevents the tongue from performing its natural function, and this is much more potent than making someone unable to swallow.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	The pain in joints is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and when pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	If you wrap it with a hard cloth, either of a fuchsia or black color, which the ulcer does not feel pain from, then do not touch that one, because it is a crack.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	If it is inclined to whiteness, in which there is humidity, then you put oil on it, and inscribe a small spatula under it, and inscribe all of the ulcer; and if the wound gets wet during the hour of your operation, then pause for three times above, because it's bitter, until the wound is restrained from getting worse.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And return to your work until you have treated it with the best of its kind, until it has been washed with vinegar and salt; and cure it with another cure at that place until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter XXXVI.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	On the extraction of an apostema from both shoulders, and that which is nothing in the groin, and the other apostemas.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When the swollen godat subsides, those are the glands which are assembled somewhat, those that occur outside and are named two aurelhas, which when you treat them, as it has been said in the division, if they do not heal, then you consider whether the apstema is hard, of a reddish color, with little feeling, then do not touch that area with iron.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of a reddish color and the rash is thick, then do not touch that area with iron for fear of the flux of the wound; put less force inside so that it may mature, and then either try to treat it or break it by itself.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of white color, redness, and the rash is subtle, then that may be an incision.

E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	It's made of silver or gold, and it's subtle with a needle.

Then press the needle into that flesh and show it to you the swelling, and cut over that your vein sometimes, then take an ounce and put it in the wound, and pull it out towards the parts outside as much as you can.

e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	And it is shaped like forceps, however the extremities of it are curved, so that the opening of one is in the hollow of the other, sharp as a knife.

So I cut the fistula openly and got stuck in one of them, pulled it out, and tied off its great piece, and after understanding from the other side, put that one inside the appendix.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	You have cut out a large portion of his limb, but it did not move or bleed excessively.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel. Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 37.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	Of the incision of a vein when an inflammation occurs.

It means: When the sanquharigga is treated with what has been said in the division of the cure and medicine, do not comfort him, consider afterwards that in the groin of the patient you expose to the sun, so that you have compressed his tongue with an instrument which you have had recorded.

E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	If it is not possible to remove that artery, then take a concave canula and insert it into the groin of the sick person, and place an iron pin in the concavity of the canula, doing so many times (until the pulse is dead and falls off the groin) and abstain from giving the patient water for the whole day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	Take a vessel full of water and put it into the mouth of the sick person, and wash the mouth with it; and do not stir up any cause or malice but give him another cup of water an hour after, because when you see how the pulse is responding to the water.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not forgotten the medicine that was recorded, then inhale the sick person with cinnamon or incense through the instrument which has been recorded in the inhalation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, as often as possible.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	There is another way of operation in inhalation of that, where you take a vessel containing carbon igniting and the vessel should be covered with a cloth, in the middle of which there should be a trigger, and the extension of the instrument should be placed in that trigger; then apply the subfumigation; and pause the sick person's mouth at the tip of the canula, and close his mouth so that the subfumigation is not forgotten until you know that it has been absorbed by the pulse, when the pulse falls.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	If not, then you should iterate the subfumigation motions several times, and abstain from nursing the patient, eat salty food and herbs, and do not drink water, because it is necessary to forget this regimen.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	This is the form of the instrument with which the stone of the gall duct is extracted from the surgeon when seen; and it is similar to forceps, sometimes, unless where there is no curvature:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is set on the surgeon, and its extremity is similar to a bee's tongue, which is good, in which it is sharpened with lime, so that when some cause is compressed, it will not be felt.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter XL.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the sum of the words in observation of apostems and in section on them.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	The apostems are certain special movements, according to what is remembered of them, from each of which in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in perforation and section of them by two means, of which one is for the special nature of the aphthasms themselves; and therefore that we may compress of their humors.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	There are certain types of abscesses that cannot be pierced but only allowed to mature with the healing of the sickness in those places or completion of them.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	Other abscesses that can be punctured when they are crossed over, and not allowed to mature according to their completion, are like those in the joints, for whenever an abscess is found near a joint, it is prolonged until you can relieve what's inside of it, which is in the circuit of it, and it is weakly corrupted by the ligaments or nerves of that joint, causing contraction of that member; or it is located on a main limb, and if you delay piercing its perforation into maturity, it will harm the main limb; or it is located near the anus, so do not pierce it when it has not matured; and it cannot be pierced raw, with no completion, but only those that are of the anus, for so that you can prevent its return to its parts outside of the anus, and it will be made a fistula, or will be done in the term of it that is not healed.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	It is possible to know the time of the abscess's perforation, and that is when it has matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	When the disease of fever is cured and the pain stops, it is known that the reduction of swelling and the cessation of pulse and temperature are followed by a hardening of the lump and other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	But how will you know when the incision is made in the place where pus has been left behind from the lump and from pus which came out during the healing of the prominence?
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And since the incision should be made through the length of the skin or flesh, if lumps are on joints or feet, and in the places of the fat, muscles, tendons, arteries; and finally in all locations where there is no reflection, whereas in those that have reflection, use incision according to the member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the lump is in meaty parts, it's better to wait until confirmation of its digestion according to completion, just as they said; whereas if you cut into it beforehand, the course of the fever will be prolonged and the swelling becomes more pronounced, and the lips are made softer, and the depth increases.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some lumps should be cut according to the size of the meat or body, due to necessity, or according to the part which requires it.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	It's not clear, but it seems to say "you must make a small incision" and then mentions the size of the incisions depending on the size of the hernia.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	Other types of hernias that can be treated by cutting open the cord and incising it, when done with a piece of cloth and made in a place where it doesn't stick, like what happens in the groin area with boils.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And there are those that have incision on the section without three angles, and of those it is incised like a leaf of myrrh, like the hernias of the groin area.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And among them there are those in which round section and lunar section are administered, similar to them.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But the one that is not like that is the hernia of a superficial or shallow type, where you can perform a superficial incision, only.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	You can only perforate it and do not extract the entire mass in that hour; take out one part of it, and allow the hernia to enter within the next day, then take out a larger part, and allow it to be repeated several times as needed until it is forgotten.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	The translation is: And much more so if the disease is of feverly nature, or a woman in labor, or a child small, or an old man in decay, because the animal spirit moves violently towards the exit of the sickness, and it brings light swift death to the patient, and you open them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	The translation is: But guard well this chapter with great caution, and place your perforation in the spot where you make the perforation, taking care to clean away the plaques and considering whether the plague of the appendix is little or flat, then administer antiserums or anticoagulants accordingly; if the appendix is large, and the fissures of the perforation are many, then carefully place a mesh between whatever passage you make until they come together again.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	The translation is: And if in the appendix there is torn off a part of the cord or you have concave that in the circuit, then carefully close it with old thread or silk yarn, as when you tie bands or stitches, add moisture; and strengthen it by the third day; and apply processes to it and cure it accordingly so that it is healed within the fever.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	If there occurs a flow of sand in the hour of operation, then you administer water and vinegar to the area where the sand flows, and place a cloth on it as soon as seen movements.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the flow of sand persists, then cover that you administer remedy and treatment, and powder which I have recommended in other places of this book and division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is in winter time, and the location of the abscess is among nerves, then cover that you pour powder into wine and oil cauterant, and place them on those places.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	But if it is in summer, and the places are fleshy, then cover that you pour crushed powder mixed with water and oil or with wine and oil, and do all this until it becomes the third day, as they have said, and then cover that you lift the abscess and clean it and administer treatment to it as is suitable for it until it heals.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is therefore the necessity of knowing the universal treatment of abscesses, but according to the distinction which I previously said about all abscesses in what manner they should be treated by means of specific methods.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the section of abscesses that come in the neck of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the neck of the head small abscesses, and these are special types of nodules that contain tunics which are their own kind; and the varieties of them have different names.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And they produce pus, and from those it is gathered that which contains humidity similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And from those it is gathered that which contains humidity similar to snow, and similarly to them; and from those that are stony, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in all sections, and when extracting those, there is no fear, as if it were the extraction of those, for the extraction does not cause a violent reaction.

And the operation in that section is to press those with an instrument of the shape which you bring near, called entretes, until you knew what it contained.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	How is this that it contains humidity, when you often slice that in section according to length, by section superficial according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	When cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body are evacuated, it is customary to excise the skin where that humidity was present, and do not neglect any other cause that may have been overlooked, because those seen returning, if another cause remains.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And now, appropriate submerge the wound in Egyptian vinegar if present, and otherwise in water and salt; fill it with that wound and ease it into another day, until such time as that corruption will completely disappear from the skin.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And now, appropriate iterate over that wound with the Egyptian vinegar second and third times if necessary, until you are sure that there is no other cause of that skin corruption; then cure the wound with the vinegar until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	If an apstema (likely meaning "apostume" or swelling) contains fat nodules, then you inscribe them in that manner.
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	In the section of that shape (crotz), put an "X" one time between two labia (likely referring to a fold or crease in the skin) and cut across it from top to bottom, and force your hand to extract the skin which contains that.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	If there is an obstruction in your bowels, then you will have to recount them first.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	Similarly, it is said in the case of the swollen, inflamed appendix, according to what has been told; and an infection on a swollen appendix is lighter, because there are few ulcers and little humidity.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	Some swellings cause abscesses in the head that occur on men who are not humid; this is because you cut into an appendix in an old woman's head and found it sound, hard, white, which could not be pierced, and if anyone struck it with a stick, they would be harmed.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other cases of appendicitis that occur on the head, this is not dealt with in this chapter, just like those that come to the heads of children; but the section of these are all superficial sections.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	Stop the perforation of those from the lower end of them, so that it is relieved of the body's pain in the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	Appropriate treatment must be done for that which is suitable for healing.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter Forty-one.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	On the section of scrofula that occurs in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Small swellings occur in the neck, and in the axillae, and in the groins; and some occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	Those are the ones that occur in the neck; and those swellings are generated between them, and all scrofula is contained within its own natural membrane, just as it is in the nodes and swellings of the head, just as they have described.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the varieties of these scrofulas are swellings, for some of them are gouty, and some contain humidity, and those that are malignant do not respond to treatment.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, in that one which you touch with good disposition, of the color of which it appears is proper to the color of the cord, and is malignant throughout all part, and not attached to the nerves of the neck, or to the veins, or to the arteries, unless where thou dost insert the same with a superficial dryness of the skin from one end of the body to the other, between the lines G and B, scorching that whole part, and stretching out the lips of the cord by one inch, or by two inches if it is necessary, as they have said in the swellings of the head, and extracting that small piece little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	It's more careful not to cut the vein or nerve.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	Be careful not to cut too deeply, lest it cause an injury that will not heal properly, or make the patient worse, and do not cut what is not necessary to cut; if you cut a vein or artery, then stop immediately from your operation, pause on the infected wound, or use other powders that stop the flow of pus, and reopen the wound, and gently apply pressure so that it becomes soft again and the swelling goes away.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the pus is discharged.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Then return to your operation once you have completed it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And inspect the area that I have previously indicated for any other small boils, so cut into those and clean those.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	If it is in the root of a large boil, cover that up as well, lest you cut into that vein.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Cover it up with a strong, thin cloth and tie it tightly so that the wound does not open up on its own.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	The translation is: And then fill in the wound with wool from Egypt that you have already uncovered, and cure it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	If you cut that scrofula all the way through, then cover up both sides of the wound and tie it tightly so that as soon as pus comes out, there will be none left over.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if there is still some surplus (pus) because of the size of the scrofula, cover that you understand to cut into it, and take it away, and sew it up accordingly as said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for those scrofulas that contain moisture, make a superficial perforation where you find the site of maturation in it, and pause the perforation so that dryness dries up the pus from beneath the body, as they have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer the perforation, with gauze that is like those, to prevent corrosion from breaking down the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And when you think that the wound is already healed, then cover it with linen of animal origin until it is fully cured.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	The section of the little finger near the tip of the appendix lump in the groin area.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	Describe this section as the epilhot, and there is none such in our land that it exists.

And we have already said in the division about the types of stones and their treatment with medicines, and the difference between stone born in the groin and stone born in the bladder, and their signs.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have said that there is a stone in which operation on the hand and finger should be done.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And the stone born in the bladder properly is that which is fixed in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	I will tell you about the manifestation and abbreviation of it.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	Therefore it is said that the stone born in the bladder mainly occurs in children, and its signs are that the urine issued from the bladder is similar to water in subtlety, and appears in that sand; and the patient feels pain on their backside, and sometimes a discharge is seen, and therefore they dress with those.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	The text means: And it is said that the cure of children in this condition takes fourteen years, and it is difficult to heal the elderly.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	It's a matter of half within them because it is between those.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And of that from which the knee is more swollen and the cure is less easy; and if it is small, it is contrary to what has been said.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	And therefore, when we arrive at the cure of that, before starting with that, we need to clear the intestine of the gallstone which is inside his bowels; because sometimes that gallstone prevents the swelling of the knee due to the inquiry of him.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And place it near the intestine and his feet and weigh him down in such a way that the swelling descends to the front of the bladder or jumps out to some other place occasionally.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And take that sponge in your hands and weigh down the parts of him so that his bladder is completely filled with urine downwards.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	Return carefully everything that has been placed outside.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Then if you feel the pain in the space, then hold onto it quickly and cut into the skin.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if the pain doesn't go away after all your touch, then cover it with oil and apply a poultice on your left hand's index finger, if the illness is in the child, or on the middle finger if it's in the young person, and insert that into their anus.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And search for the pain within yourself while holding your finger.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	Convert and gradually move that small amount into the base of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	And press it against that with your finger, and release it to the outside parts beyond the area where you made the cut.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio. E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And be aware that from the bone there is one which has no angles or margins, making it difficult to extract.

E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	But if the stone is very large, then ignorance is that you cut into it with a large section, because one of two causes happens to the patient: either they die or they accidentally ingest urine continuously, so that the location is not fully consolidated.

Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	A stone in the female genital area is rarely found.

De castracio.	On castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias. E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And therefore I say that castration is done in two ways: by cutting or by dividing the section.
