Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Now begins the procedure of the second part: restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is more often necessary in the art of medicine; and it is restoration of fractures and accidents in bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh son, know that fools call themselves wise doctors and those who in their ignorance ignore the books of the Ancients and do not even recognize a single letter from them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason, this way of learning in our land is private; and you have not forgotten it at any time, being wise enough to keep it hidden, and only disclosing it after a long period of studying the Ancient books and understanding their meaning, from which you extract the science.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And I will direct my experiments and studies over the course of my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And you have already described here in this chapter everything that contains my science and on which is passed the main experiment; since I will shorten it for you others and deliver it from obscurity of length; and I will abbreviate it at the end of abbreviation; and I will show it to you at the end of declaration; and I have formed there some forms of the symptoms that are administered in that case, just as I did in the two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	The first line translates to:
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	The sum of and collections regarding fractures of bones, from which certain necessities must be removed, before we begin to remember the bones that have been fractured and different ones.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, let us speak of the sums in this chapter's prologue, and the capitals to which they relate, the understanding of which will be clear at first, when it is known who are the craftsmen and where is placed the truth about them; for it is you and those who know or can learn these noble arts other than yourselves.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore I say that when such accidents occur - a fracture, dislocation, twisting, or collapse - you must go to it first with leucotomy or cauterization of the place, or whichever method, if no other cause is present, then as weakness of virtue, or that which happens by accident, or due to decay and age, or because of excessive heat, or cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And therefore let it be contented with seven days' supply of bitter herbs and fowl meat and crab apples; and prohibit heavy meats and filling them with victuals, until you are sure to apply cauterization on the vein, before applying the dressing securely, and if you do not fear the effusion of matter into the limb.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the illness to its primary regime, which it customarily follows.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And therefore when the broken bone begins to be restored, it is necessary that the illness be nourished with nutritious foods such as meat and fat and thick ones in which its viscosity, just like those nourishing foods of wheat cooked with water, rice, heads, feet, entrails of cows, pigs, fresh flesh, big and similar to these, should be eaten, for this regimen is done to cause coagulation of fracture more gently and less painful.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	It is known that bones are fractured when in old men who have lived in their first house and in the elderly, it is not possible for them to continue and be consolidated according to their nature due to the dryness of the members of their body.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continue according to their nature at all times due to the dryness of those members, just as the bones of children's fists.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	But nature also adjusts and connects to the broken bone on every part any kind of substance similar to glut in which it grows adhering and strengthening that within which are compacted and joined joints, just as fire at the beginning, until there comes the end of firmness and solidity, such that no cause prohibits its work.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And because of this reason, it is necessary to hold back the patient's food, foods in which his gravity and viscosity and grossness are such that we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	There is a great variety of fracture according to the diversity of the member.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	You know that the species of fracture are diverse according to the diversity of the members, for the fracture of the hip bone is different from the fracture of the head bone; and the fracture of the toe bone is different from the fracture of the foot bone; and in the same way, all the other members are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	I will remember the description of all sorts of fractures, exposed in their distinct capital chapter from one another.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	There is great diversity in fracture itself.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	They are diversified the species of fracture of bone in their own essence; for it is a curvate fracture here, where accidents occur at its joints; and some fractures are made according to the length of the bone: and so are the fractures of the straight bone and the star-shaped ones, and those that proceed from within and those that do not, just as it is done in the pen when it is being prepared to write, and there is a fracture with a plague and disruption at the head, and a small fracture fissure.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And it is entirely strange or torture proper in the restoration of him, according to what will come back to memory of his places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Signal for a bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And therefore is known the fracture of the bone: it is a twisting of him, and of that prominence and appearance to the feeling, and thus when you press on that part with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore when it is not in the twisted place and there is no such movement or pain does not occur greatly, unless you touch the bone with agitation, then the illness does not afflict great pain.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	Sometimes it may be twisting or small fissure, and then you should not press on it with your hand and apply compression of all; sometimes pause over it of the medicines from which you see remembrance at that moment that corresponds to the place; and let be straight for subtle constriction.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And it is wise that the place when it is arched and not divided into two or other there you should not proceed to it, since it has been all repaired from its whole separation; then it becomes clear that you must start from your hour to rectification of it, whenever you see that occurs apoplexy caution.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	If it happens to the patient that an ulcer forms on them, then let him lie down for several days until the ulcer ceases; and place him on such a method as you can lift with weight and with ingenuity.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	You know that the restoration of a wound and its closure is lighter than the fracture in which it occurs.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	Place him on such a method that he will remember what happened to him.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if the fracture has set in the bone, then it is necessary to extend that broken member, either the arm or the leg; unless it is your hand, if the member is small; or two ligatures or one ligature and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	So hold the patient in that position where you place the broken member in its natural place, while extending the separated parts of the broken limb; then be sure to force those additions back into their place with ingenuity and according to such a method as you can.

Watch yourself carefully so that it does not happen over the patient because of your operation or injury; and force yourself according to your power that you apply one bone to another, in its proper form.

Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	But the length of it is according to what you can do at the operation; let there be two opposite sides with times, and one side broad and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	If the disruption of the wound which you have incised when you removed the swelling from the bone is wide, and it is safe to apply cauterization, then you will tie together the two lips of the wound with suture.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	If the disruption is little, or you fear cauterization, then you will apply the wound with rags and powder according to the quantity of the wound's incision.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	If an apothecary occurs, then immediately wrap in linen cloth, oil, and vinegar, and place it on that.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	When the bone is swollen and fractured, then apply plaster made of flour and milk and vinegar, placed on the stop (I assume you mean "top" or "surface", but in this context it seems to be a specific term), and allow to dry after removing the stitches from around it, if needed. And take human bone marrow, which is called the Sarrazis, that is long and has a length of one palm or more over it; and apply two kinds of powder on the stop and plaster; and take a small wooden splint with a length similar to that; wrap up that drap (I assume "drap" means cloth) around the stick, wrap that cloth around the stick with the stick in the place where the fracture is located; allow it to be soaked in human bone marrow as if it were rotating, and rotate that over his back and remove the stitches from his wound and its pain, and return it completely when the fracture has a complete alignment, and that will not occur on you.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And all, that the star above the broken bone is not spoiled; and so cover that you may see the malady every day, when the ligament becomes soft or the star was already infected, then you correct this and strengthen the ligature.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And then pause the sleeper of the malady on the back of him, and pause that which makes him (sleep) uncomfortable, so that he may sleep on a small cushion in the night, for this will make it elevated that his assistant is raised by him from the bed of that one, and therefore the fracture of the forked bone is raised to elevation of the muscle; or the arm of him is tied to the back of him.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not release the ligature unless it happens at that precise or aposta-ma location, within twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula. De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	Restoration of shoulder fracture.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The broken spatula is stuck in the back of it, and not broken itself, but its edges.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	Therefore, when the place is fractured — if it's fractured in its middle part — and it cannot be seen but by touch, then according to how the fracture shape is, you prepare for it and reduce it, as much as possible, forcing it back into its natural form, in any way that can.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	And place powder of millet meal and alum over the location, then stop the pain; place powdered cloth twice over it; and place a soft bed sheet on you, according to the quantity of the spatula, either all or just a little.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if the bed is concave in one of the spatula's locations, then you cover that concavity with powder and stop the pain, and place the bed according to equality.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And place strong under, with humectated tongue, and care on the constrictions of the bed, so that the stiffness does not come from the bed's location.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	Consider when the pain is present in any day; and whenever it has softened, tie another bandage on it, press firmly on the joint if it is inflamed again from its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	Place the patient on their back so.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	And if it is restored in twenty days or fifteen days.
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	Therefore when it has reached this number, then at once loosen the bandage, and know well whether it is from the bones of which the beginning was not feared nor dissolved.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you proceed from the location of the bone push and put off the chain, then at once cut over it, remove it, and do as they have said in the fracture of the furcula, sacrum and appendix caudae, if an accident occurs here.

De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	Of the restoration of the fractured foot.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The foot sometimes breaks in the middle of it and causes inflammation there; but the extremities are more inflamed than the broken part.

Capitol .xii.	 Chapter twelve.
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	Of restoring a fractured arm.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus. Capitol .xiii.	The chapter/section on the thirteenth topic.

E majorment cove que tu fassas aquo en fractura, e quan am aquela es plagua propriament.	It is more necessary to do this in a fractured state, and when it is inflamed properly.

Consider it every day, and study it thoroughly, so that you may keep away from inflammation, infection, or other similar causes; and whenever any of these conditions occur, oppose yourself to it, so that it does not spread while the patient is being treated.

De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	The healing of the knot that occurs in the stump of a fracture.

De sermo en dislocacio.	On the matter of dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is a consequence of some joint being displaced in the patient's location, so it is prohibited from movement, and the figure of the limb is adjusted, and it brings pain and great injuries to the patient.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when it happens that there is a dislocation, cover and perform as soon as possible to reduce it, and do not delay reducing it, because if it is delayed, the place becomes swollen and strong with it, and it makes it difficult to reduce the dislocation.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	It's causing pain and inflammation in the affected area on the day of the operation.

Capitol .xxviii.	The head of a gouty person

When the hand has some bones dislocated, and the reduction of the joint is light, but in other joints it's heavier, however being cautious to perform the reduction quickly when the swelling is high or an abscess occurs.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of a joint dislocation is that you place the injured hand's joint on a table, and the minister extends the other arm, while the doctor places his hand or palm over the proximity of the joint, and pushes it back into its normal position.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	However, if the palm is already exposed to the abdomen of the hand, then the patient places the back of his hand on a table, stretching and reducing it; and if the dislocation occurred first, then the minister places the other arm's elbow over the table, in order for the doctor's hand to fit exactly over that proximity of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	If you return to that point soon, good is; and if not, then hold fast that arm until the swelling subsides and the abscess goes away; and do not repeat that process, for if so, you will suffer or be unable to perform the reduction of that pus which accumulates over the days.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	But the joint is bent according to its tortuosity; and do not notice any cause in the patient, except that the hand is softened and no strong cause can be held fast; therefore you know that the nerves are cut or torn, and you should not put it into anything but tie it up with a cautery so that this also causes no further pain.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Then if it is badly swollen, you will rest on the swelling where it has retracted, and let it be softened and held fast for 4 days; and then release it and let it be softened and let your hand be exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	But if the movement of it is restored and there are no serious accidents, then you will loosen that arm with warm water and with friction some times, until it is alleviated.

De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	The treatment of dislocation of the fingers.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Sometimes, dislocations occur in all parts of the finger.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	When any finger is dislocated at the knuckle or in the palm of the hand, it is customary to stretch and pull the finger back with both hands, until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And then support the head of the finger, and suspend it by the part to which it is dislocated, and let it rest for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then suspend that finger and extend it until it is straightened in three days.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when it is not straightened, apply that according to the same method, and do not cease to remove it in the day and exercise it with movements, and apply this for several days until it is straight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do the same for that, if it is dislocated at the palm of the hand, and apply it to that part and perform this first operation on you, until you are healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And do the same for that, when it is dislocated in other parts.

De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	The treatment of dislocation of the vertebrae in the spine.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When any of the vertebrae in the spine or neck are completely dislocated and must be replaced with other vertebrae, as this is not a cure, because death comes from the disease.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And this is how the disease of the body comes outside the will, and cannot be held back; and sometimes seen are softening of the limbs of him or both of his legs or two of his arms, or one of them; or sometimes it is replaced with another vertebra in its place, as often it is replaced and often there is a removal of those four parts.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	And then it has been replaced with the parts behind, and is named goutiness.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	But the cure for him is that you should consider whether the goutiness occurs in childhood, because then it is neither a cure nor a complete healing.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel. E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	It is a disease that occurs in the foot when the skin splits open, and it is neither a cure nor a remedy for that. And similarly for those that are made on two sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And it is not cured but rather the one that occurs in those two places themselves, where you recommend.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And it is that the malady extends its face over the swell on the jaw, close to the wall, and also extends it from there with a wet instrument so that the foot of him does not get hurt.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And place a stick of medicine in the swelling, put it on the ground at the end of the jaw around his head, and another stick over the feet of him in the other extremity of the foot.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And let the minister hold the stick and not press it into the wound; and another minister shall hold the other accordingly.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And wrap around the head of the sick person and let loose the tie which is pressed; extend the extremity of the tied part to the stick which is meant for his head, and attach that to him; and wrap tight the other tie over his legs, under his knees, and on his back, and adjust all the ties and attach them to the other stick which is meant for his feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And now that the minister has extended the linen to the beginning of the chest, and have not tightened the two chests and the linens at his location, but rather do not tie it up as we have said.

But if he does not return in this manner, then take a table of which the latitude or longitude is at an angle of three arms, and dig into the wall from which we have said that is the place of the sickness, near the extremity of the table.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And place the middle of the table on the vertebrae, and the doctor will place his weight on the other extremity, and stretch out before that the vertebra is constricted, and return to his own place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you wish, open the turn which is turned with the hand; and it is that you come to earth because the head of the sickness is in the back of the chest, two chests, the length of which is one arm, and place your head on the back of the chest; and be the length between any two chests a palm, and already it has been done in each chest through which the turn runs, and every one that is fixed to the earth so that it does not move.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And if it were a vessel of blood in which the turnings are, and turned on both edges of both vessels.

And in the extremity of it there is a vein where the vessel is formed, the length of which is one palm-sized and turned over; and in the other two vessels it is similar to that.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu. De curacio de anca dislocada.	On the cure of a dislocated ankle.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Be aware that the joint of the ankle and the joint of the muscle are not involved in only dislocation, so alone; but accidents occur at those other joints due to small movement and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the ankle is dislocated in four ways: one that it is displaced outward, another outward from behind, another from beneath, or another from above.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	The translated line is:
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	When the joint dislocation occurs at the joints is that quar, when you adjust the cushion of the patient's back to the patient, it is longer and the pain is more pronounced than of the healthy one, the patient cannot bend his knee because he speaks with the tongue tied, and this is the place where the tongue is stuck with the apostema caut, so that the head of the wound is already present here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	The point where such a dislocation occurs is at the external joints, because it is contrary to that injury.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	The point where such a dislocation occurs at the anterior joints is that expansion of the same segment follows completion, but however it does not bend that joint which is in pain, and if you press further to go forward, he cannot be put on his anterior joints; and the urine of him is retained, the swelling of him is apostemat, and therefore one should walk on the heel.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	The point where such a dislocation occurs at the posterior joints is that it does not expand the pain, nor can you bend the joint in front which bends his swelling, because the bandage of him is shorter than the other, and the swelling is softened, and therefore the head of the wound is in that place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	The pain of joint dislocation is reduced by considering that, often, if the dislocation is old and ancient, it has already been treated with reduction, and you administer reduction accordingly, and follow its disposition, for not all treatment in this case is; and therefore do not cover that there will be a prompt recovery.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	In those in whom the dislocation is recent, and it is one of the four kinds of dislocations, you call for this that you turn the joint and extend it to the parts of the intestine and to the parts outside, and apply it to the right and left, until it returns in its place, without needing another treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	However, if it does not return in this manner, you cover that you prepare a strong minister and extend the chamber of him from the part outside, or on his hands, or on the ligature which is tied over the denud area; and another minister extends the hand of that person as to insert his hands behind the titles of him; and place a strong ligament on the root of the cyst, and have another minister tie the extremity of the ligament.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	The area of tension or from the beginning to the inflammation at the junction of the anus and the rectum.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	The extent of all those things in one side that the sickness is elevated on its body and remains standing.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	This type of extension is common to all four.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	So if the displacement returns to where we have said, it is good; otherwise, it is necessary to consider all that has been spoken about its own cure.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of one's own, when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is at the openings, as the sickness is raised on its left side; and place the ligatures over the root of the wound in that location, where between the head of the wound and the place where it was left exposed.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And another strong minister will take the harness of it, and apply to the large part of the sick wound and extend in front to the openings by great tension, so that that returns to its place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	This condition is of light treatment, in which this member is reduced from the others.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if it is allowed to exclude you from this treatment, then cover the two feet of the sick person tightly bound together with a strong rope.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	Let the length of one foot be measured by the quantity of four words, and let the area between the thighs be extended more than the other by two words.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	Let the patient be suspended over his chest, and in the middle; let the length of him equal to two arms.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	Let command a strong youth to pinch the head of the hernia, and let it be suspended by the sick person on another youth; and the other youth shall pinch the hernia firmly, that the joint returns to its place with speed.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	But in the reduction itself, when it is a dislocation at the outside part, cover that the sick person jumps on a hard cushion as they have previously recommended; and strengthen the binding over the sick person's own belly and over his foot.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	Make two pads fasten on the feet of the patient and one on the head; and make the second pad fasten to the middle of the foot placed over which the wet drapes are wrapped, so that the disease may not be aggravated by the fact that the fist is between the thighs, lest the extension be directed towards those parts which should be avoided.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	Let anyone stretch out his limb, and the doctor wraps up the reduction according to art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Then if he follows the remedy correctly, it will be of great benefit; and if not, place pressure on that spot diligently, for as they have said in "gelbozitat" ( likely referring to a medical text), concerning the wrapping.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	But know that the disease will be worse on his later days because of his treatment.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is in front of the joints, it is necessary to extend the cushion lightly, and it follows this medieval narrative on foot; and let the doctor place the palm of his right hand over the swollen joint, and fix with another hand, and fix that extension towards those parts behind by the side of the bone.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	If the dislocation is behind the joints, it's not good to cover that the patient's malady extends to those parts and is elevated above the earth; anyone can put a hard cushion under, just like when the joint is displaced outside, as we said about two joints; and since his face is swollen and ligaments are extended, according to what we have said, there's no advantage.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	Anyone can apply compression on a table over the place where the joint is applied.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	And then, since the reduction is completed, as you know - and do not hide from me the sign of the reduction, for I see that you extend the malady onto two shoulders, and when you stretch those limbs and the malady extends its shoulder and expands those excruciations, then surely you will know which member is returned - and then you adjust two cushions and place a strap to prevent that joint from being swollen in any of those parts; and fix the malady to rest for three days or four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And remove the ligaments and the strap, and compare one to the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	If you see those swellings in your garments, then you know that the joint has already been fixed, and thus the sickness will move.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	If you see some cause of softening, then you return and put that in place, and extend it according to your first structure, and fix it after three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And remove that, and make it to take its time in movement over some point for a few days, until it is comfortable.

De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	Of the cure for joint dislocation of the thumb.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The thumb is dislocated in three manners: when it is displaced outward, and when it is displaced inward, and when it is displaced more to the left than to the right, and when it is displaced more to the front.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of joint dislocation is that you command the patient to place his hand in the wound; then you know that the thumb has been dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	The text means: 
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And so the remedy for a cure begins with his cushion adhering to the space not weighed down by labor.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And so place him in that position and his cushion adheres to the space, and wrap those with membranes in a cloth for three days or four, and then unwrap them.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	Do not use the patient's bed for walking for several days, until he is healed and strengthened.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio. Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	On the cure of the dislocation of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The ankle sometimes gets reduced by small movement, and sometimes it is dislocated according to its completion, and the dislocation of him occurs either at the joints inward or outward.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of his ankle's dislocation is that it swells before it proceeds to the joint at which he is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	The translation of the text is:
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	Mays in the cure of him when he is dislocated according to the proper form, cover that you cut the wound deeply, and hold it with a strong and valiant servant of the left side behind his knees in the middle place of him.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And place your right hand on the upper part of the thigh and your left hand on the lower part of the foot in the area of the wound.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And pull the foot towards your right hand and hold it with the left for two times, and extend the left hand; and push the foot of the foot with the right hand so that the cushion works.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do this twice according to what has been counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And push the foot into the cushion on the third attempt, and you are at the wound.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	So if he returns in one attempt or in two attempts according to this manner, and if the foot is pushed back into place, then that is good; otherwise, for sure, over him iterate the operation, because he will return.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	If it is not allowed to reduce the swelling at this place, then lay the patient on their back over the ground, and stretch out a cloth on solid earth, which fits between the thighs of the patient, and you have already covered the patient with a sheet so that they do not slide.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And let the minister place their thighs, and another minister extend the foot over their hands or a linen cloth stretched on the neck of the foot; and let extend that any minister who can against extension of his back, so that the patient's body is not drawn to the parts that are subjected to the swelling, and let him hold that which retains the swelling, between the thighs of the patient.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And let the doctor bind the dislocation with their hands, and another minister hold the healthy cavity to the affected parts, so that the dislocation returns to ease.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And therefore when the dislocation returns and it is declared to you that the swelling has been reduced, then bandage again and extend with a strong linen, and bind the foot with a linen to the leg.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	I fear a fracture of the nerves behind the heel, in order that the ligament may not be severely strained and the bone may become more firmly fixed.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And place the ligature for two days or three, and if the ligament is softened, remove it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And take away that ligature on the fourth day or in the fifth, and prohibit the patient from moving for forty days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if it is necessary to move in front of that space, there is no secure guarantee that the dislocation will not be dissolved and corrupted, so take action where it would not receive cure.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if an apostema occurs in it, cover that as described in the previous part of our narration, in another place of cure and dressing, until it has been healed.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	End of Book IV.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	On the Cure for Dislocations of the Toes and Feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	So that the one who is displaced be brought back by a short extension of its work; and if it is not difficult, make it lighter.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	If the displacement is in two or three joints of the foot, then take care to fix the ulcer on his foot over a layer of earth or table, and let it be so as if he were going.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And then stand on the foot and place your foot over that which you imagine is near the joints, and take a shoe to put on that foot with the sole inside so that it does not appear in the raised place.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And place the belly of his foot on a table that will take up the entire foot, with two ends, and take strong enough leather structure to be decent and firm for three days; then remove it and let him rest by walking for some days, until he is strengthened and assured in recovery.

De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the kinds of dislocations that are caused by a plague or by a fracture or by any other injury.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any of those cases occur, and you penetrate the wound of that one and in the restoration of him, most often success happens not to happen death.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	Forcing oneself so that one can begin to reduce the swelling in the beginning of the cause, before discovering the apothecary's caut.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then if the member returns as one wishes, then administer a regimen that will bring about apothecary's caut and cure the plague with what is suitable for him from the remedies against dry cough.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if dislocation is accompanied by fracture and the bones become separated, then perform the statement of their union, and do in this regard what has been said about simple illnesses of this kind, which precedes treatment at the affected areas.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And guard and avoid what is in the way of fear according to your own judgment, as has preceded my prediction; for it is better for you than it would be for me, your Creator, and more permanent for your glory, and may you have more blessings in your true body at that time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	I will finish with the words of Al-Quasim perfectly as dictated, may God be blessed in doing so.
